column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Adhering to a code of conduct
username_0: **Disclaimer: The following is a personal contribution, and does not necessarily reflect the views of GitHub, my employer.**

A code of conduct is important because it promotes moral behavior, acts as a guideline for ethical decision making, enhances the reputation of an organization, prevents negative legal effects, encourages positive relationships, acts as a reference for solving ethical dilemmas and prevents discrimination or harassment.

Harassment and abuse are significant factors in preventing the entire community of tech companies, user groups, open source projects, and other organizations and events from being truly diverse and welcoming to participation.

Also, a well-written code of conduct clarifies an organization's mission, values and principles, linking them with standards of professional conduct. 

This aligns well with this project's inferred mission of helping people becoming better programmers and software professionals.

@sdmg15 as this repository' maintainer, you are setting the example for thousands of other developers. You can contribute to making this community, GitHub, and the world a better place by fostering a welcoming, diverse and inclusive culture! You've got a great power in your hands, but with great power comes a great responsibility üôÇ 

Thanks for creating this repository! :heart:
<issue_comment>username_1: This PR supersedes #125
<issue_comment>username_0: Thank you for merging this @sdmg15! üíû

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Steam bridge broken
username_0: The Steam bridge doesn't work anymore. 
After quick investigation it seems they change the way they display games: datas are in the body with a Javascript variable in a <script> tag and add to the DOM after the page loading.
<issue_comment>username_1: Do you have an example URL for this ?
<issue_comment>username_0: http://store.steampowered.com/wishlist/profiles/jacknumber

I have written a fix for this, PR comming.
@username_1  Anyway to reopen the issue, this PR will resolve it.
<issue_comment>username_1: I closed it because it's fixed !
<issue_comment>username_0: Their is 2 notices in Debug mode.

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: ‚òÇÔ∏è Umbrella issue for v2 docs
username_0: _Creating issue for the link for now, will update details later (but soon-ish)._

### Have you read the [Contributing Guidelines on issues](https://github.com/facebook/Docusaurus/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#reporting-new-issues)?

Yes
<issue_comment>username_1: @username_0 I would like to help with some of the parts
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 sounds great! You may PR directly for the piece you hope to work on. Thank you!
<issue_comment>username_2: assigning myself for docs on docusaurus/linj, withbaseurl, head, etc
<issue_comment>username_3: @username_0 I would like to contribute to some of the docs namely Guides/Blogs for a start. I went through the documentation and the docs folder of the project and went through the guides-blog.md file. But am unable to understand what type of changes to be in that doc piece. I am a beginner by the way so any help on this would be really appreciated.
<issue_comment>username_0: hey @username_3 thank you for offering to help! Based on the file names you mention, seems like you are looking at v1 docs. To clarify, this issue is for Docusaurus v2, which is a completely new static site generator with focus on doc sites. 

If you are hoping to hop on to v2, the toc in this issue are referring to the docs [in this directory](https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/master/website/docs). You should be able to match the files there. And within the actual files, there are "work in progress" status marks alongside some references.

Would you like to give them a try?

If you prefer to work on v1 docs as you may be using it, that is ok too. Please let me know which part you'd like to work on, and I'll see if I can provide any guidance on that.
<issue_comment>username_3: Thanks for the help. As suggested by you, I was looking out for the files in the wrong directory. I want to contribute to the docs namely Guides/Blogs for Docusaurus v2. I referred to the corresponding doc for Docusaurus v1 for getting some idea about it, but am unable to get a clear idea as to how to get Docusaurus v2 up and running on my macOS Mojave version 10.14.5 and access the Blogs section for creating Blogs.
Any guidance on getting started with Docusaurus v2 Blogs would be much appreciated. Meanwhile I am learning how to use Docusaurus and trying to understand its features by deploying a demo website going through [Docusaurus Installation](https://docusaurus.io/docs/en/installation).
<issue_comment>username_0: Hey @username_3, once again the [Docusaurus Installation](https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/issues/1640#issuecomment-524809087) docs you are referring to is v1 docs. V2 docs are [in this directory](https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/master/website/docs), and a website version is [in Docusaurus v2 site](http://docusaurus-2.netlify.com/).
<issue_comment>username_3: Thanks. Working on it!!!
<issue_comment>username_3: While going through the [Docusaurus Contributing](https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/blob/master/website/docs/contributing.md) document found that the [Discord Invite](https://discordapp.com/invite/9wrnhY) to join the docusaurus-2-dev channel seems to be invalid due to possible expiration of the invite. Not clear whether an issue needs to be created for this or not.
Kindly look into it @username_0 if possible, so that other new contributors can use the channel to their aid.
<issue_comment>username_0: Hey @username_3 can try [this link](https://discord.gg/sq3k3j7)?
<issue_comment>username_3: Thanks @username_0. The provided link works fine. 
Created a demo Blog markdown file in my system after looking at the sample Blogs present in the my-website folder of the Docusaurus v2 clone made following the [Installation Guide](http://docusaurus-2.netlify.com/docs/installation). 
Exploring the various features involving creation of blogs in v2 release and planning the documentation content side by side. I hope it would be fine to take some inspiration from the [v1 documentation for Creating Blogs](https://github.com/username_3/docusaurus/blob/master/docs/guides-blog.md) for the format and content of the v2 documentation.
Kindly correct me if I'm wrong. Planning to raise a PR soon if all goes well.
<issue_comment>username_0: Hi @username_3 yes it is perfectly ok to use v1 as example. Looking forward to you PR :)
<issue_comment>username_3: @username_0 have created a draft markdown file for blog.md for Docusaurus v2, am reviewing it and would raise a PR soon. I have shared the same with you on Discord. Your inputs on any modifications required are most welcome.
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_3 sure, will do by this week
<issue_comment>username_0: hey @username_3 i've read through the draft and it's looking great, plz go ahead and PR this in :]
<issue_comment>username_3: @username_0 have raised a [PR](https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/pull/1786) on this.
<issue_comment>username_2: Currently, it's not so obvious what are the available themeConfig option for `@docusaurus/theme-classic`. We should document it https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/tree/master/packages/docusaurus-theme-classic

Example: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/pull/1909/files
<issue_comment>username_3: If I'm not wrong we need to augment the existing documentation for [using-themes](docusaurus/website/docs/using-themes.md) for v2 to add details about themeConfig option for @docusaurus/theme-classic right?
<issue_comment>username_2: You can start editing https://v2.docusaurus.io/docs/theme-classic for the theme config. I have provided an example
<issue_comment>username_3: Sure thing.
<issue_comment>username_4: From what I'm reading it seems like the Infima framework powering v2 is not yet public? I'm trying to figure out the best way to override globals (fonts), and while I see how to override the coloring scheme, I am unable to find a full list of `--ifm-` variables. Is there anywhere I could find these? Also, how should I be directly accessing the document <head> to pull in customizations like Google Fonts? Do I setup my own theme to override the classic-theme?
<issue_comment>username_2: @username_4 how about trying https://v2.docusaurus.io/docs/docusaurus.config.js#stylesheets
<issue_comment>username_4: Yeah that would definitely allow me to import different styles, however that's not really my concern. I could probably hack in some `!important` statements inside the custom css stylesheet --- just trying to find the most elegant solution. Is there a full list of `--ifm-` variables anywhere? The [Infima](https://infima-dev.netlify.com/) doesn't look to have the docs ready. Thanks for the help regardless. There is some pretty cool stuff being done within this project!
<issue_comment>username_5: Is it possible to support @ material-ui / styles of material-uiÔºü
<issue_comment>username_6: @username_5 mind elaborating more?
<issue_comment>username_5: Using @ material-ui/styles on the server side requires additional processing, and the converted style needs to be entered into the html string.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50414099/74654704-e1632600-51c5-11ea-9716-e539f8488f86.png)
<issue_comment>username_5: Thank you for your timely reply. Will you consider doing this support?
<issue_comment>username_6: Please file a separate issue, this issue is not the right place to discuss about it. We are shorthanded at the moment but maybe external contributors might help out.
<issue_comment>username_5: Thank you for your reply.üò¨
<issue_comment>username_6: I was browsing the pages at https://v2.docusaurus.io and I felt that the docs were very complete and hence I came to look at this issue and just realized that this issue is already 95% done! Amazing work @username_0 and the others!
<issue_comment>username_6: Our docs are in a much better place now compared to a year ago. There are some TODOs left in the code, but I'll clear them up. Closing this issue! Thanks again @username_0! ‚ù§Ô∏è<issue_closed>
<issue_comment>username_7: Hey, I would like to help !!  are there any tasks left I can work on? @username_0
<issue_comment>username_6: @username_7 this task is closed

[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'alexseixas69sp', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2021-04-23 11:19:35+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': "Hi people,

I miss a simple functionality in Full Node bitcoin-qt and bitcoind, that retains the last goal of node.
Due to slowly consolidation of the last blocks validation before the first time free run of the node, expending several days or weeks, I need to improvise with a crontab cron job of
$ cat ~/.bitcoin/blocks/blk000*.dat > ~/.bitcoin/bootstrap.dat.
Even when the option -reindex-chainstate directly into bitcoind, it's was unable to restart at last block validated shutting the block mapping again and again to 2009, in case of stop, crash or power failure.

Best regards.", 'title': 'I miss a simple functionality in Full Node', 'type': 'issue'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'mrsteve0924', 'comment_id': 828702271.0, 'datetime': '2021-04-28 18:57:28+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': "so after an improper shutdown of the node, you lose all the block history since you last started the node.  is that what you are describing?  that's happened to me a few times.  i started to manually shutdown and restart weekly to avoid the issue.  i'm hoping moving to version 0.21.0 fixes the issue", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'alexseixas69sp', 'comment_id': 828755457.0, 'datetime': '2021-04-28 20:27:35+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': "Hi Steve, I'm using the version 0.21.0 and stalled bellow 49% of download try outs in a week. The reason of improper shutdown, data corruption and unsuccessful recover was found and appears to be only a hardware issue. The manual creation / backup of bootstrap.dat helps me a lot, but due to intensive memory R/W operations the 5V and 3.3V power sources are stressing after some hours of operations. Installing lm-sensors in Linux was useful to diagnose it. I recommend to you check out this first.
Thank you and good luck!", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}]
column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: I miss a simple functionality in Full Node
username_0: Hi people,

I miss a simple functionality in Full Node bitcoin-qt and bitcoind, that retains the last goal of node.
Due to slowly consolidation of the last blocks validation before the first time free run of the node, expending several days or weeks, I need to improvise with a crontab cron job of
$ cat ~/.bitcoin/blocks/blk000*.dat > ~/.bitcoin/bootstrap.dat.
Even when the option -reindex-chainstate directly into bitcoind, it's was unable to restart at last block validated shutting the block mapping again and again to 2009, in case of stop, crash or power failure.

Best regards.
<issue_comment>username_1: so after an improper shutdown of the node, you lose all the block history since you last started the node.  is that what you are describing?  that's happened to me a few times.  i started to manually shutdown and restart weekly to avoid the issue.  i'm hoping moving to version 0.21.0 fixes the issue
<issue_comment>username_0: Hi Steve, I'm using the version 0.21.0 and stalled bellow 49% of download try outs in a week. The reason of improper shutdown, data corruption and unsuccessful recover was found and appears to be only a hardware issue. The manual creation / backup of bootstrap.dat helps me a lot, but due to intensive memory R/W operations the 5V and 3.3V power sources are stressing after some hours of operations. Installing lm-sensors in Linux was useful to diagnose it. I recommend to you check out this first.
Thank you and good luck!

# Background Information

# Goals

* If you want to changed everything up (this is okay) then please open a pull-request *when you start your work and incrementally ask for feedback*. **do not wait until work is finished before sending in the pull-request** (this will break my heart and your heart)', 'title': 'Users need more context of what they are looking at', 'type': 'issue'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'KallynGowdy', 'comment_id': 322016434.0, 'datetime': '2017-08-13 01:45:39+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': 'IMO if I was someone who never knew about ReactiveUI or what it does, the homepage would be the most confusing. So, there are a couple of things that I would change with it:

1. The one-liner explanation only tells me that ReactiveUI is a "advanced, composable, and functional MVVM framework". As far as I'm aware, that's pretty much what every MVVM framework is (apart from the functional side). Maybe it would be better to focus on what ReactiveUI gives them? (e.g. "Gives you the power to build reactive, testable, and composable UI code using the familiar MVVM pattern")
2. Our list of features is below the community section. While I appreciate how much community is at the center of ReactiveUI, I'm assuming a lot of users don't really care at the moment they are trying to learn what ReactiveUI is and does for them.
3. We don't have a call to action. For what it's worth, I think this could simply be a prominent link to some getting started docs. The purpose is primarily to give them an avenue to learn more.

I could draft up these changes so we can discuss in a PR if anyone wants that too.', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}

column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Users need more context of what they are looking at
username_0: Here's a video of the problem:

[![](http://img.youtube.com/vi/EwqeKoPVDXQ/0.jpg)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EwqeKoPVDXQ "")

# Background Information
* Website uses bootstrap v3, less and is generated by wyam.
* Instructions how to build the website is in the README.md

# Goals
* Report back with ideas, if the fix is simple then send in a PR right away
* If you want to changed everything up (this is okay) then please open a pull-request *when you start your work and incrementally ask for feedback*. **do not wait until work is finished before sending in the pull-request** (this will break my heart and your heart)
<issue_comment>username_1: IMO if I was someone who never knew about ReactiveUI or what it does, the homepage would be the most confusing. So, there are a couple of things that I would change with it:

1. The one-liner explanation only tells me that ReactiveUI is a "advanced, composable, and functional MVVM framework". As far as I'm aware, that's pretty much what every MVVM framework is (apart from the functional side). Maybe it would be better to focus on what ReactiveUI gives them? (e.g. "Gives you the power to build reactive, testable, and composable UI code using the familiar MVVM pattern")
2. Our list of features is below the community section. While I appreciate how much community is at the center of ReactiveUI, I'm assuming a lot of users don't really care at the moment they are trying to learn what ReactiveUI is and does for them.
3. We don't have a call to action. For what it's worth, I think this could simply be a prominent link to some getting started docs. The purpose is primarily to give them an avenue to learn more.

I could draft up these changes so we can discuss in a PR if anyone wants that too.<issue_closed>
<issue_comment>username_0: Here's a video of the problem:

[![](http://img.youtube.com/vi/EwqeKoPVDXQ/0.jpg)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EwqeKoPVDXQ "")

# Background Information
* Website uses bootstrap v3, less and is generated by wyam.
* Instructions how to build the website is in the README.md

# Goals
* Report back with ideas, if the fix is simple then send in a PR right away
* If you want to changed everything up (this is okay) then please open a pull-request *when you start your work and incrementally ask for feedback*. **do not wait until work is finished before sending in the pull-request** (this will break my heart and your heart) - open one _right away_
<issue_comment>username_0: üëç open PR's early + happy to jump in a video call and pair with you on this stuff.
<issue_comment>username_0: Let's keep this discussion on context and information design - moved homepage improvement discussion over at #22
<issue_comment>username_1: Maybe [breadcrumbs ](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Breadcrumb_(navigation))could help for mobile users? Not sure how we would implement them with Wyam though.<issue_closed>

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Packages in Preview not being cued for harvesting
username_0: These two packages are not being queued for harvesting.  @username_2 identified the issue as "As for the packages below, these are preview versions, so these versions are not displayed in https://clearlydefined.io/harvest page when trying to pick a version."

https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms

https://clearlydefined.io/definitions/nuget/nuget/-/microsoft.powershell.native/7.0.0-preview.1
<issue_comment>username_1: Sorry @username_0 , i don't get what is the issue on the website here. Maybe an extended explanation of the problem would help. Thanks!
<issue_comment>username_2: The specific versions are nuget/nuget/-/Microsoft.PowerShell.Native/7.0.0-preview.1 and nuget/nuget/-/Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms/3.0.0-preview5.19224.8

I assume the user has tried to harvest these components from https://clearlydefined.io/harvest but the preview options do not show up. I wonder if it's by design. If so, should we be fetching all the versions here including the preview ones.
<issue_comment>username_2: It looks like the packages have been harvested using /harvest API:
```
{
	"tool": "package",
	"coordinates": "nuget/nuget/-/Microsoft.PowerShell.Native/7.0.0-preview.1"
}
```
It seems like the crawler has ignored these package versions possibly due to preview version. Moving this work item to crawler to investigate.
